For people who liked Hyper Dimension Neptunia, this is a must buy . To be fair, I've had my playthroughs of final fantasy and other rpgs, so to me, this turned to be more interactive and strategic than most . There's plenty I like about the game, but a few others I dislike. I'll start with what I like :D

Positive
- Funny, not too many games that introduce a humorous cast of characters actually make me smile and laugh.
- Beautiful art style and anime, characters look and act how they were made
- Easy combat system, items, attack, combos and spells pretty generic but very satisfying to see those combo strings and multiple damage hits
- Basic but fair storyline, very generic and simplistic story to follow and understand

Negatives
- Rushed, many of the characters are thrown into your way and then into your party about 2 minutes after you meet them without even really understanding why or who the hell they are
- Repetative; its a very simple system: go to town, events, buy info, free swords, go into dungeon, grind/complete quests (repeat) the side quests and events are really the only thing besides the storyline you can do
- Very short dungeons (also a pro) The dungeons are usually consisted of less than 5 areas, you can complete the main quest in a matter of minutes
- Protagonist (also a pro) I may get anime people jumping on back for this lol: the protagonist made me laugh and he does grow and develop throughout the game, but its just a hero I cannot get behind and makes me strongly dislike him later in the story. The early part had me laughing, but later on had me facepalming, honestly I wished  Sherman was the main protagonist, thats my opinion though lol.
- Brief tutorials, while most people generically know what their doing; its a little bit of a slap in the face that Eryn's tutorials pop up for like 3 screens going , yeah this is how you do this and this
date: good luck finding  these matierals yada yada. " The game doesn't tell you where you can get specific items or materials.\n\nI still play the game and I still haven't finished the main story
recommended: so I'm no expert whatsoever; however this is a very fun game to play and kill time. The art style
hoursPlayed: the graphics and the gameplay are very fun . I'd play this when you get a lot of time and feel for a simplistic set back style game."

Have you played the Neptunia remakes? This game is similar except instead of jokes on video games, the industry with silly fanservice, it's silly JRPG story spoof with puns on that and ...more fanservice.

It's very very similar to Neptunia, characters you get have combos you develop over time and they can transform to gain abilities and perks. The game feels like it had a much, much fatter budget however. Supported by the fact they have some Squaresoft employees doing things like music and art. Animations seem better done, there's less stuff re-used (though I've already run into a enemy that was in Neptunia so, there's that to think about) more enemy variety, ally variety etc.

The convo's with the animated sprites are better done than Neptunia as well, they have different poses, more of them, more on screen happen and they're more lively.

The game is more grounded than Neptunia however, it's less off the wall and ...more 'normal' but it's still insane. It has more depth to it in it's gameplay overall and larger dungeons ...they're still nothing wildly complex but they're serviceable. Characters are more customizable with how you develop them by way of fairies being linked to them and where you put points into their stats.

Don't expect deep complex story telling here, it's light hearted, silly and ...well one of the screenshots has a wierd green bear character, so c'mon. (haven't gotten that far yet) What I do like is, everything moves fast, or is skippable, so you don't get stuck watching an overly complex move for the 5th time, just hit LT/L2 and you're onto the next thing. Even convos can be skipped so you don't have to sit through plot you may already have.

It's good, certainly a fun game so far in my opinion.
Buy it if you love Ishihara Kaori.Toyama Nao and Iguchi Yuka

Fairy Fencer f was beautiful. This is going to be a long review, so if you don't like reading, then the first sentence sums it up.

I've played many RPG and JRPG games through my life, and most of them were pretty spectacular. Golden Sun, Persona 3 and 4, Pokemon (if that counts), Chrono Trigger, Fire Emblem: Awakening, and Skyrim, to name a few. So I'd like so think that I've seen all the odd's and ends of what RPG/JRPG games should feel like.

Fairy Fencer f had every good thing RPG's have to offer. The story, the art, the music, the characters, the combat system, the customization, the grind (maybe not good to some people), and most importantly for me, a DYNAMIC main character. I'll be going into details, trying to avoid spoilers since I always hover over them anyways.

Story:
FF's story seems basic at first. Two deity's, the benevolent Goddess and the vile Vile God, each fighting to take over the world. They both get sealed away, and the world is left alone all normal. Your quest is to collect Furies (sealed fairies) in order to revive the Goddess and get your wish granted. Seems prety run-of-the-mill, right? But then you meet your two protagonists, the unlikeable Fang and the sarcastic Eryn, and you quickly get pulled in by Compile Heart's signature comedic dialogue. And in classic JRPG form, a TON of twists happen throughout the game that make you upset, confused or heartbroken. They come fast and strike hard, leaving you devastated or driven enough to keep playing; to solve whatever just happened. The story is far from basic. It's a wonderful tale of treachery, love, heroism, justice and cookies. Oh and Pippin I guess...

Art & Music:
Everything in this game was gorgeous. The landscapes, the cutscences, the characters, even the menu's were well designed and easy to use. The music gave emotions to the dungeons and aligned with events in the story; mystery, excitement, regret etc. I will say that you'll be sick of hearing the word Metamorphosize" halfway through the game
date: since it's the first word of the theme song that plays when you Fairize.\nI figure I should also mention Voice Acting since that was pretty great too. I used the English voices because I knew Christine Marie Cabanos was in the cast. There was plenty of emotion
recommended:
and none of the voices were painful to listen to like Compa from HD (Except Pippin)

The Character's:
I'm as much of a fan of your "Tsundere" or  "Onee-Chan" trope characters as the next guy. Heck
hoursPlayed: I played through Hyperdimension and found it enjoyable. For those of you who don't know
voteText: basically a trope is a stereotype
helpfulPercent: for example the "Rich girl with the annoying laugh". But there were only three characters I can think of that fit into a solid trope: Soji
votesHelpful: Apollonius and (maybe) Zenke.\nAll the characters were so completely diverse
votesTotal: and their chemistry was amazing. You had the "Tsundo-masochist"
votesFunny: "Jarl Ulfric the Baker"
commentsCount: "Kill
column16: Kill
column17: Kill"
column18: and the "Japanadian". All the characters had interesting backstories
column19:
and you really felt like you were growing with them on their journey. Just not Pippin though.

Combat/Customization/Grinding:
The game consists of an Overworld
column20: a single Town
column21: Goddess Revival and Dungeons (Shukesoo's Tower included). Similar to most RPG's
column22: the dungeons are filled with non-random enemy encounters that trigger a battle sequence. You can gain the advantage outside of battle by hitting the enemy first (akin to Paper Mario).\nThe combat system is almost identical to Hyperdimension; turn-based strategy. You can customize your team in many
column23: many ways. You can change combos

column30: accessories and even fighting styles (Turning a brawler into a gunner
column31: for example). The only thing I was disappointed with in terms of customizations is that  there are only two costumes per character . Everyone gets a default costume and a bath towel/bathing suit (DLC
column34: who has three.\nI love grinding in RPG's. Shoot me

column37: or an archer etc. It's very fun to play around with different strategies. I never used Pippin though

so I can't give analysis on that...

allow him to get at you and then you will feel all the emotion I felt through this game. Amazeballs.

In conclusion!

reviewText:
Before we start, keep in mind that I will make a lot of comparisons with Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth 2, that I will call from now on R2. I've made a review of that game too, so if you're curious go to my profile and read it.
Fairy Fencer F was a game that I bought shortly after R2, and paid full price. At first, I thought it was just a simplified copy of R2 and I left the game on the side for months. A week ago, I chose to give a chance to the game, and I'm really glad that I did, because it was a unexpected awesome journey.
Let's talk about the combat first: It's a turn-based JRPG, but you can move in your turn. Each character has a different attack range, and you move in your turn to reach the enemies to attack.  You can attack normally, use skills, magics, itens, escape, activate each characters special condition or Fairize. This last command can be activated when your tension gauge is full and it lets your character make a fusion with your fairy, making you temporally stronger and activating some special skills.
The normal attacks, unlike R2, only hit one enemy, despite the range of the weapon. Speaking of weapon, since your fairy is your weapon, you can boost the atributes and unlock skills, magics and normal attacks. For example, you can raise the amount of normal attacks you can perform in your turn, unlike R2 where all characters can attack 4 times and there is no ''skill tree'' to unlock.
You will collect more than 20 fairies in the game, and you can equip them to each character to make a resonance effect, and create some new abilities or boost some attributes in the equipped character. Since the story of the game talks about the battle of the Evil God vs the Godless, you can go to a certain shrine where both are pierced by many swords of different ranks, and you can use fairies of the matching rank to take away that sword in a battle and create a shaping effect on your fairy. This shapping effect will buff or debuff certain attributes or skills in the dungeons and some even change the enemies of those dungeons.
Each character has some kind of achievement to complete, like ''Walk 1000m as the leader'' or ''Win 10 battles without taking damage''. Those achievements will raise stats like Agi, Str, HP, SP, etc. It's something that it's not present on R2 but it's now present on R3.
Leaving the combat mechanics behind, let's talk a little about the story and character development. Since Fairy Fencer F it's from the same creator as Hyperdimension Neptunia, and Neptunia it's a game with a lot of jokes, without taking itself too seriously (except if you take a specific route in R2 that it's dark as ♥♥♥♥), I was expecting the same here, and when the main character first appeared, I thought this game would be a bad copy of Neptunia. At first, Fang is basically an idiot and I wasn't liking the character in the first hours.
But the game managed to surprise me with one thing: character development. Soon, Fang starts to get more mature and the events around him force him to change. This is another crucial difference from R2: the story is way more serious. There will be blood, deaths and regrets. As the story progresses, even the way Fang talks change, reflecting his own change. There are three endings: the Normal End and two endings, one for each girl. I will not tell who they are. I've only got ''A girl ending'' but the romance felt convincing and I really cared if they would manage to stay together in the end, which is a surprise, giving that most games have bad developed character interactions and romances. Unfortunately, not all characters are developed and I didn't care about some of them in the end. There's one in specific that I think it's very stupid (Pippin), and ironically you can use him as a weapon in R2.
Oh, there is another surprise too: the OST. The songs are awesome. Check them out on youtube.
But there are a few bad things, for example. there's just little world customization compared to R2, and less endings too compared to R2. The enemies are repetitive, only changing colors as they grow stronger, and some dungeons are repetitive too. Those are the same problems of R2, but I felt that there's only a few original enemies in Fairy Fencer F compared to R2. I missed some events and characters, but I don't feel like playing it again to complete what I missed, unlike R2 where I beat the game 3 times.
That said, with it's great story, character development, combat mechanics and progression and an awesome OST, Fairy Fancer F is worth full price, and it's a game that I will always remember with care. If you like this genre, go ahead and buy it. You will not regret it.

Although it plays slightly differently than its relative HyperDimension Neptunia, Fairy Fencer F has a lot of the fun and goofy quirkiness that you'd come to expect from the companies involved with the game. However unlike the HyperDimension series Fairy Fencer F takes on a slightly more serious approach to their story. The game's combat is a bit repetitive and that's the only complaint I have with the game (its combat system is quite similar to that of the HyperDimension series), however what really drew me in to this game are the whacky characters, particularly the lazy main character Fang. There are some good laughs to be had here and if you love the HyperDimension series then I can HIGHLY RECOMMEND this game to you. If you're not a fan of those games however then honestly you may not like this one either, unless it was the characters in HyperDimension that turned you off. Either way, if you're in, then bear those fangs (pun-intended) and JUST DO IT.

10/10 would laugh at Vilegod Sherman's face again.

For anyone on the fence about this game, it's your typical RPG-turn style fight kind of game with the ability to modify dungeons a little bit.  EXP boosts, Weapon upgrades, Drop increases and the like are all able to be modified a little bit.

The game has some cheesy lines, some pretty good references if you can spot them, and is overall fun to play. While the replayability is kind of low in my opinion (the 2nd playthrough thing is completely useless) and some of the secrets you won't even have a chance to think about unless you knew it was coming, but the characters are fun, the skits are really funny and of course, the Fan-Service isn't too bad. Multiple endings mean you'll have to play the game at LEAST 3 times before you see everything, but it's still a fun game.

If there was one thing I really didn't like about the game, it's the amount of time you have a particular party member in your group for. I know there are games where you lose your party members if you're not careful, like in most Fire Emblem games, but this was a little ridiculous.

Other than that, it's a fun game. Plenty of impelling plot-twists (some cliche others not so much) but all in all, a fine game.

Some Cons for my Taste:
- Keybinding is ♥♥♥♥.
Took me a while to make the keybind similiar to my NepNep Game. Aka "What is this button do? Where should i put it?"
I am using KeyBoard btw.

- Grinding for 100Mil Gold Trophy is PITA
Seriously... PITA. This Game has the hardest 100mil Money Trophy compared NepNep Rebirth 1/Rebirth2/ Rebirth 3.

- No Weapon Changing in term of Stat/ Changing Weapon Equipment
U can change ur Armor/ Ring to get higher stat like buy from Store. But ur weapon is same. This Game use "Upgrade System" to raise ur Weapon ATK. Not bad. But on late game when ur Upgrade System already max it started to feel weird. No feeling for "What is the Best Weapon for [Insert Character name here] coz u always wear same weapon from begining lol. So on late game pretty much only stat from Level to raise ur Damage aka ur Weapon stat will be same. I prefer a Game with "This is the Late Game Weapon for X Character" Stimulates me to grind for that Late/End Game weapon for sure."

If you've played the Hyperdimension Neptunia games, then you've played this one, at least mechanically. That's a good way to tell if you will like the format of the game. Obviously, there's a completely different set of characters and a separate plot. Overall, I really liked the game, but there are some problems. The lead character, Fang, starts out aggressively annoying and Tiara is only a little better at the beginning as well. Fortunately, the two have character arcs and they do grow and get a lot more engaging. Some of the achievements are way too grindy and if you don't have the DLC dungeons, then it could take days to get 100,000,000 gold. The same is true of many of the challenges, but fortunately, you don't need to complete any of the challenges to have powerful characters.

Great game if you like hyperdimension neptunia you wil like this game.
The story is not so interesting in the first one hour,but the game grows gradually.

This is a really fun JRPG, its battle system is familiar and fun, grinding is pretty enjoyable and pays off significantly.
There are many areas where your characters will be tested even if you grind like crazy, the best thing is that these areas are optional so you don't need to worry about needing to grind in order to advance in the story.

I'd strongly recommend it to anyone who enjoys JRPGs.

Title got me

This will actually be my first ever review for a steam game as I am a new PC gamer (finally got a alienware woohoo!!) so i just want to say what i thought about this game playing through it all (keep in mind i have played this game before on ps3) here we go:

music: 8/10

As a huge hyperdimension neptunia fan who has every game of nep nep and seen the anime series i have to say this nigh-equal game has awesome music when you do whats called fairize" the music changes to this upbeat rock looped song i have no idea what its called but the songs are awesome and really get me into the fight when im fighting monsters that are way out of my league lol my only problem is that the songs do get boring after awhile if you play alot due to it being just a single looped song for fairize/nonfairized but this isnt a big deal so who cares i do love the cutscene music that plays and the opening is nice.

Story: 9/10

Now i know there will be at least one neptune fan that will attack me in rage when i say this but unlike hyperdimension neptunia this game actually has a story....kinda.....sorta....almost.....idk.....at first the story was all over the place and funny like any game similiar to neptunia but then about a third of the way through the story all of a sudden picks up and i found myself screaming hell yea as Fang kills everyone to make way for reviving the goddess THEN *IT* HAPPENS i wont give spoilers to any possible newcomers to this series but if you beat this game you know what *it* is once that happened i found myself strangely shedding a tear screaming no TIARRRRRRRAAAAA!!!!!!! DONT LEAVE ME I CANT LIVE WITHOUT MY MASSOCHISTIC CRAZY FANCY SPEAKING BUNNY EAR WEARING CUTIE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
THATS WHEN I STOOD UP AND GRINDED AND GRINDED AND GRINDED ON THE POOR DUNGEON MONSTERS TILL I WAS STRONG ENOUGH TO DEFEND MY LOVELY BUNNY GIRL FROM *FUTURE* HARM (NO I DO NOT HAVE A THING FOR TIARA AT ALL NO WAY.....T...THATS NEP-POSSIBLE!!!!!)

CHARACTERS; 8.5/10

IF YOUR A NEP FAN THAN YOU BETTER NEPPIN' BUY THIS GAME!!!!!!!! THE CHARACTERS ARE AWESOME!!!!! THIS GAME ACTUALLY HAS MALE CHARACTERS AND THE LEADING PROTAGONIST OF THE "FANG GANG" NAMED FANG......IS PRETTY UNIQUE AND AWESOME HE COMES OFF AS A RUDE SELFISH HUNGRY PUNK AT FIRST WITH ABSOLUTELY NO SENSITIVITY AROUND WOMEN (TIARA DOESNT MIND THOUGH LOL) BUT THEN YOU START TO SEE THE REAL FANG AND HE IS ACTUALLY A PRETTY SWEET GUY WHO JUST LIKES TO HIDE HIS TRUE EMOTIONS/FEELINGS CAUSE HE DOESNT WANT ANYONE TO WORRY ABOUT HIM.
THEN THERE IS ERYN AND TIARA WHO ARE AWESOME CHARACTERS TOO (TIARA IS MY FAVORITE THOUGH) TIARA IVE ALREADY TALKED ABOUT HER....ERYN HOWEVER IS ADORABLE AND LIKE A LITTLE SISTER ALMOST TO FANG HER AND TIARAS CAT FIGHTS ARE HILARIOUS!! XD

MEH I GOT TO GO PLAY MORE NEP NEP SO IM CUTTING REVIEW HERE JUST BUY THE CODHAMMED NEPPIN GAME NOW!!!!!!!!! NO DISSAPOINTMENT AT ALL AND A NEW GAME IS COMING OUT FOR THIS SERIES (SAME GAME BUT WITH DIFFERENT SCENES AND STUFF)

Meh... can't say too much about this. Took about 20 hours to beat but wasn't very difficult to do so. Bosses are pretty easy all the way to the end. I only got one ending  out of three apparently but I'm not feeling too motivated to get the other two. I was really playing for the sake of knowing what happened at the end and it wasnt very satisfying i have to say. Pretty cliche anime-type ending but I wasn't expecting much more than that.

Characters weren't bad but if you are familiar with anime or manga at all they all fit into the typical character types, which is  pretty much a given as soon as you are introduced to the main character. Cliche as they are they are still fun to listen to.

The sound and music are decent but nothing special at all and you quickly realize there isn't a very large musical score to accompany the game and you'll here the same tunes over and over again.

The areas are pretty small  and there really isn't any exploring. There is an ability to search for inivisible items but I hardly used it because just didnt seem worth it.

There is a game-plus" mode where you play the game again with what appears to be levels and abililties from your previous clear but honestly not sure why you would do that.

Gameplay was alright
